bastar-dussehra.name: Bastar Dussehra
bastar-dussehra.description: The world's longest festival celebrating Goddess Danteshwari with unique tribal rituals.
bastar-dussehra.meaning:
Unlike the traditional Ramayana-based Dussehra, Bastar Dussehra is a 75-day long celebration dedicated to the indigenous deity **Ma Danteshwari**. It is a profound expression of tribal unity, where nature, royalty, and local deities converge in a series of unique rituals.

The festival originated in the 13th century and has been preserved by the Bastar royal family and the local tribes. It is not a celebration of Rama's victory over Ravana, but a thanksgiving to the nature goddess for her protection and health.

traditions.title: Path Jatra
traditions.description: The ritual marking the beginning of chariot construction with logs from the forest.

traditions.title: Kachin Gadi
traditions.description: A young girl from the Weaver community grants permission to begin the festival while seated on a swing of thorns.

traditions.title: Rath Parikrama
traditions.description: Massive wooden chariots, pulled by thousands of tribals, circuit the city of Jagdalpur.

charta.name: Charta Festival
charta.description: A harvest festival celebrated by the tribes of Koriya region.

navakhai.name: Navakhai
navakhai.description: Celebrated to welcome the new rice harvest, offered first to the deities.

surhul.name: Surhul
surhul.description: Focused on the worship of Mother Earth and the Sal tree.

narayanpur-mela.name: Narayanpur Mela
narayanpur-mela.description: One of the biggest tribal fairs in the region.

koriya-mela.name: Koriya Mela
koriya-mela.description: Showcases the rich culture and traditions of the Koriya district.

fagun-wadai.name: Fagun Wadai
fagun-wadai.description: Celebrated in Dantewada with great enthusiasm before Holi.

hareli.name: Hareli Festival
hareli.description: The primary harvest festival of Chhattisgarh where farmers worship their tools and cows.
hareli.meaning: Hareli, derived from the Hindi word 'Haryali' meaning greenery, marks the beginning of the agricultural season. Farmers worship their farm equipment and cows, praying for a good harvest.

traditions.title: Tool Worship
traditions.description: Farmers clean and worship their agricultural tools.

traditions.title: Gedi Race
traditions.description: Children and men walk on bamboo stilts (Gedi) through the muddy fields.

madai.name: Madai Festival
madai.description: A magnificent traveling fair held across different tribal regions, famous for its grandeur.
madai.meaning: Madai is a traveling festival that moves from one village to another. It is a time for tribes to meet, trade, and celebrate their local deities.

traditions.title: Procession
traditions.description: The procession of the local deity, Anga Deo, is the main attraction.

rajim-maghi-punni.name: Rajim Maghi Punni
rajim-maghi-punni.description: Held at the confluence of Mahanadi, Pairi, and Sondur rivers, known as the Kumbh of Chhattisgarh.
rajim-maghi-punni.meaning: A holy gathering at the Triveni Sangam (confluence of three rivers). Devotees take holy dips and perform rituals similar to the Kumbh Mela.

traditions.title: Holy Dip
traditions.description: Devotees take a holy dip in the river confluence at sunrise.
